Package: org.ysb33r.groovy.dsl.vfs.impl

[Groovy] Class AntPatternSelector

    • org.ysb33r.groovy.dsl.vfs.impl.AntPatternSelector
    • All Implemented Interfaces and Traits:
      FileSelector, java.lang.Cloneable

      @groovy.transform.CompileStatic
class AntPatternSelector

      Allows for Ant-style patterns to be used for selecting files. If no include patterns are specified then everything will be included. If some include patterns are specifed only matching files and folders will be included. If exlcude patterns are specified, files and folders are only included, if they do not match any exclude patterns. Patterns may include:

    • to match any number of characters
    • to match any single character
    • '**' to match any number of directories or files

      Unlike GRadle or Ant '\' cannot be used for folder separation. Only '/' is allowed as all references are relative URIs

      Authors:
      Schalk W. Cronj√©

        • @java.lang.Override boolean includeFile(FileSelectInfo fileInfo)

          Determines if a file or folder should be selected. This method is called in depthwise order (that is, it is called for the children of a folder before it is called for the folder itself).

          throws:
          Exception if an error occurs.
          Returns:
          true if the file should be selected.
          Parameters:
          fileInfo - the file or folder to select.

        • @groovy.transform.PackageScope boolean matched(java.lang.String[] parts, java.util.Map<java.lang.String, java.lang.String> patternSet)

          Replaces the current set of excludes with a new set

          Returns:

          Replaces the current set of includes with a new set

          Returns:
          Parameters:
          includes - One of more ANT patterns

        • @groovy.transform.PackageScope java.lang.String[] splitRelativeURI(java.lang.String subject)

        • @java.lang.Override boolean traverseDescendents(FileSelectInfo fileInfo)

          Determines whether a folder should be traversed. If this method returns true, includeFile is called for each of the children of the folder, and each of the child folders is recursively traversed.

          This method is called on a folder before includeFile is called.

          throws:
          Exception if an error occurs.
          Returns:
          true if the folder should be traversed.
          Parameters:
          fileInfo - the file or folder to select.
